Welcome to my site wherein I have attempted to aggregate information about spectrum, auctions and other related issues impacting the Indian Telecom Sector. Since most of the information is fragmented, I thought it will be useful if these are placed in a structured form to enable easy access. While doing so, I have made every attempt at maintaining accuracy, but inadvertent errors cannot be ruled out. In case you notice any, please provide feedback ( @Parag_Kar ) so that the same may be corrected.

item.title: Auction Pricing
item.description: The following table lists the reserve and discovered prices for all auctions held till date in Rs Cr/MHz. The topmost row of every block list the year in which auctions took place and the row below indicates the respective bands. “RP” is an abbreviation used for reserve prices and “AP” is used to indicate the prices discovered in the auctions. The cells marked as “NA” identifies those circles which were either not offered for auction, or no bids were received during the auctions.

item.title: Auctions
item.description: Between 2010 and 2016, six auctions have taken place. This resulted in a total bid price over Rs 3.5 Lakhs Cr. The years during which auctions have happened are listed below. 2010 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 The summary of the band pricing “Actual” (emanating out of every auction) and “last” (emanating out of most current auction) is also listed for enabling easy reference. For a detailed analysis of all the past auctions, please refer to my note tilted “Indian Spectrum Auction: The Key Issues and Learnings”

item.title: Band Price
item.description: Since 2010, the spectrum in licensed bands is being assigned through a transparent process of auctions. Therefore, every auction has a reserve price and a market-determined price (emanating out of the auction process). In general, these prices in have increased over the years, and are listed in the table titled “Actual Price“. However, since all auctions did not include all circles. Hence, the market prices for a particular service area can be deemed as those discovered in the last auction.

item.title: Harmonization
item.description: Harmonization is a process to enhance the quality of spectrum bands so that they can support data at a much higher speed. In past, the 1800 MHz band was harmonized which increased the quantum of spectrum available for auction by 10 times. In future, the following are the potential bands for harmonization. 600 MHz band 900 MHz band 2300 MHz band
